alert.note: Alert for Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Starr and southeastern Zapata Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 609 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lopeno. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lopeno, Viboras, New Falcon, Falcon Dam, Fronton, Morales-Sanchez, Salineno, Falcon Heights, and Falcon State Park. This includes US Highway 83 between mile markers 780 and 804. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
